column1: The City of Doncaster & Templestowe was a local government area located about 20 kilometres (12 mi) east-northeast of Melbourne
column3: Australia. The city covered an area of 89.42 square kilometres (34.53 sq mi)
column4: and existed from 1915 until 1994. At its peak in the early 1990s
column5: it had a population of just over 100

column1: The origin of local government in the area dates back to 19 December 1856
column2: when the Templestowe Road District was formed
column3: following a public meeting and election at Bulleen Hotel. Two decades later
column5: the Shire of Bulleen was formed
column6: incorporating the Roads Board area and Warrandyte. On 30 May 1890
column7: the Doncaster Riding was severed and incorporated as the Shire of Doncaster
column8: meeting in the old Shire Hall in Council Street. By this time
column9: fruit growing had become the mainstay of Doncaster's rural economy. The Shire of Bulleen was renamed to the Shire of Templestowe on 12 May 1892 and reunited with Doncaster 23 years later under local government reforms on 1 October 1915
column10: with the combined entity named the Shire of Doncaster & Templestowe on 16 March 1926. Urbanisation was slow to reach the area
column11: and the 1949 Australian Blue Book described the shire as "mainly undulating country with extensive views [and] some low
column14: dairying and sheep and cattle grazing
column15: dominated the shire's economic life. By 1955 the population of the area had grown with suburban settlement and a new Shire Hall was built. On 28 February 1967
column16: at a time of rapid suburban growth
column17: Doncaster & Templestowe was proclaimed a City.On 15 December 1994
column18: the City of Doncaster & Templestowe was abolished
column22: was merged into the newly created City of Manningham.At the time of dissolution
column23: council meetings were held in the Municipal Offices
column25: Doncaster. This facility is still used for the same purpose by the City of Manningham.

column1: The City of Doncaster & Templestowe was subdivided into four wards
Mitcham (shared with the City of Nunawading)
Ringwood North (shared with the City of Ringwood)
Warrandyte South (shared with the Shire of Lillydale)
* Estimate in the 1958 Victorian Year Book.
The City of Doncaster & Templestowe had about three hundred parks by the 1990s.
